title: Do you live in an area that people consider dangerous? - Quora

response.answer_text: A number of my friends up north thought I was crazy for moving to Florida after 50 years of living in Minnesota and North Dakota, because of the hurricanes, which can make this a very dangerous place. That’s in their eyes — to me, who has gone through two hurricanes (Matthew in 2016 and Irma a couple of months ago,) I don’t really see them as being all that problematic. If a bad one looks likely to hit (and Daytona is in a somewhat unique position to avoid that,) we can just leave, otherwise, put up the shutters, clear off the patio and pool deck and wait it out. Pretty much every place has some element of danger, whether by nature or by man, so it comes down to weighing the potential for danger against the benefits of that location. Today, it’s about 72°F and I’m sitting on my lanai, enjoying the weather. Meanwhile, in North Dakota, it’s 20° and in my hometown in Minnesota, currently 23°. For me, that’s a benefit that far outweighs the possibility of danger from a hurricane. Ironically, this came up on Facebook as a “Memory” from one year ago, today:  That’s a 90° difference between Daytona and my former hometown of Grand Forks, North Dakota. The largest difference that I’ve seen was about a hundred degrees.
If yo go kayaking at the wrong time or don't get an accurate weather forecast and are unprepared to sit out a storm, then yes, I live in a very dangerous place.
